item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:23, topic:371733”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=467801.msg3421990#msg3421990 date=1291586004]

[quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=467801.msg3421970#msg3421970 date=1291584756]

When I read the title I expected to read a story about a ‘victim’ shooting or otherwise beating the mugger, but it was actually a really good story. He must have just sensed the kid was in trouble and could be talked to though, it probably wouldn’t be a wise thing to try all the time.

MITB would have shot him!

If I felt in danger for my life, I would have.
[/quote]would you have shot the adolescent mugger in this situation

Impossible to say without actually being in the situation, as each situation is different. As I said, if I felt my life was in imminent danger then yes, I would have.
[/quote]would you have shot him if you thought he would have just left on the condition of you handing him your wallet[/quote]

I wouldn’t kill someone to protect my wallet, but if threatened with a knife from a good enough distance I’d probably pull out my gun and tell him to drop the knife.

item.title: A Victim Treats His Mugger Right
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

This is much better then shooting the kid. A lot of people still don’t understand that most muggers do their thing because it’s their last resort.

You can’t discern between a malicious mugger and someone who does only want your money. That’s the problem.
I don’t like it anymore than you do, but that’s all there is to it.

At the end of the day, you have a right to be protected and kept safe. If someone infringes on that right, or indicates that they may infringe on it (by holding you at knife point), then you can’t always afford to be a do-gooder.
This guy lucked out.

If you reacted this way to someone who was interested in harming you then you’d get fucked up, or you’d get dead.
